channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: Regime Change In Tehran? Putin Says Iran Consolidating Around Its Leaders

media:content.media:description: Putin said Iran's underground uranium enrichment facilities were still intact.

item.description: Russia -Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that Iranian society was consolidating around the Islamic Republic's leadership when asked by Reuters if he agreed with Israeli statements about possible regime change in Tehran.
item.content:encoded: Russia -Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that Iranian society was consolidating around the Islamic Republic's leadership when asked by Reuters if he agreed with Israeli statements about possible regime change in Tehran.

item.title: Trump Privately Approved Attack Plans For Iran Pending Final Order: Report
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump told senior aides late Tuesday that he approved attack plans for Iran but has withheld a final order to see if Tehran would abandon its nuclear program, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: U.S. President Donald Trump told senior aides late Tuesday that he approved attack plans for Iran but has withheld a final order to see if Tehran would abandon its nuclear program, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

item.title: Iran On The Cusp Of Regime Change? What Reza Pahlavi, Son Of Shah Of Iran Said

media:content.media:description: Reza Pahlavi, son of the last Shah of Iran, called for a revolt against Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei

item.description: As the people of Iran face uncertainty, with its Supreme Leader holed up in a secret bunker at an undisclosed location, with the nation in utter disarray and chaos amid an Israeli military onslaught, an old and familiar voice has arisen.
item.content:encoded: As the people of Iran face uncertainty, with its Supreme Leader holed up in a secret bunker at an undisclosed location, with the nation in utter disarray and chaos amid an Israeli military onslaught, an old and familiar voice has arisen.

item.title: European Ministers To Hold Nuclear Talks With Iran Tomorrow: Report

media:content.media:description: According to the source, the talks are to be followed by a structured dialogue at the expert level.

item.description: The foreign ministers of Germany, France and Britain plan to hold nuclear talks with their Iranian counterpart on Friday in Geneva, a German diplomatic source told Reuters.
item.content:encoded: The foreign ministers of Germany, France and Britain plan to hold nuclear talks with their Iranian counterpart on Friday in Geneva, a German diplomatic source told Reuters.

item.title: PM Modi Concludes Visit To Croatia After Meeting Top Leadership

media:content.media:description: PM Modi met Croatia President Zoran Milanovic to discuss a range of issues to boost bilateral ties.

item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday concluded his visit to Croatia, where he held talks with the Balkan nation's top leadership on a range of issues to boost bilateral ties.
item.content:encoded: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday concluded his visit to Croatia, where he held talks with the Balkan nation's top leadership on a range of issues to boost bilateral ties.

item.title: Microsoft Planning Thousands Of Job Cuts: Report

media:content.media:description: Microsoft had 228,000 workers as of June last year.

item.description: Microsoft is planning to cut thousands of jobs, particularly in sales, as the tech giant streamlines its workforce amid increased investments in artificial intelligence, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.
item.content:encoded: Microsoft is planning to cut thousands of jobs, particularly in sales, as the tech giant streamlines its workforce amid increased investments in artificial intelligence, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

item.title: As Donald Trump Hosts Pak Army Chief For Lunch, What The White House Said

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump hosted Pak Army Chief Asim Munir for a special lunch at the White House

item.description: US President Donald Trump hosted Pakistan's army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir for a special luncheon at the White House on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump hosted Pakistan's army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir for a special luncheon at the White House on Wednesday.

item.title: Explained: How Trump Took A U-Turn On Iran After Israeli Pressure

media:content.media:description: Trump wanted diplomacy but believed military options would help in talks.

item.description: In his inaugural address in January 2025, US President Donald Trump made a promise: "Our power will stop all wars and bring a new spirit of unity to a world that has been angry, violent and totally unpredictable."
item.content:encoded: In his inaugural address in January 2025, US President Donald Trump made a promise: "Our power will stop all wars and bring a new spirit of unity to a world that has been angry, violent and totally unpredictable."

item.title: 'He Died In Fear': Telangana Man, 55, Dies Of Heart Stroke In Israel

media:content.media:description: Ravinder's daughter Akanksha said his father used to call from underground bunkers

item.description: A 57-year-old man from Telangana, who had travelled to Israel in search of livelihood, died due to ill-health, his family said on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: A 57-year-old man from Telangana, who had travelled to Israel in search of livelihood, died due to ill-health, his family said on Wednesday.

item.title: Dalai Lama To Issue July 2 Message, Expected To Address Succession
item.description: The Dalai Lama will issue a message on July 2, days ahead of his 90th birthday and a hugely anticipated decision as to whether he will have an eventual successor.
item.content:encoded: The Dalai Lama will issue a message on July 2, days ahead of his 90th birthday and a hugely anticipated decision as to whether he will have an eventual successor.

item.title: Baby Born To Brain-Dead US Woman Kept Alive Due To Abortion Law
item.description: A brain-dead pregnant woman who was kept alive in the southern US state of Georgia due to local abortion restrictions has given birth, officials said -- with the mother then removed from life support.
item.content:encoded: A brain-dead pregnant woman who was kept alive in the southern US state of Georgia due to local abortion restrictions has given birth, officials said -- with the mother then removed from life support.

item.title: Israel-Iran Attacks LIVE: Tehran's Internal Security Headquarters Destroyed, Claims Israel

media:content.media:description: Israeli air defence systems are activated to intercept Iranian missiles.

item.description: Israel-Iran Conflict Day 6 LIVE Updates: The deadly conflict between Iran and Israel entered its sixth day on Wednesday, with both sides widening their attacks.
item.content:encoded: Israel-Iran Conflict Day 6 LIVE Updates: The deadly conflict between Iran and Israel entered its sixth day on Wednesday, with both sides widening their attacks.

item.title: Iran Crypto Exchange Hit By Hackers, $90 Million Destroyed
item.description: An anti-Iranian hacking group with possible ties to Israel announced an attack on one of Iran's largest cryptocurrency exchanges, destroying nearly $90 million and threatening to expose the platform's source code.
item.content:encoded: An anti-Iranian hacking group with possible ties to Israel announced an attack on one of Iran's largest cryptocurrency exchanges, destroying nearly $90 million and threatening to expose the platform's source code.

item.title: Donald Trump On Striking Iran: "I May Do It, I May Not Do It"

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump has said the US "may" join Israel in its conflict against Iran and its Supreme Leader

item.description: Hours after Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei warned the US and its President for interfering in the Iran-Israel conflict, saying US will "suffer irreparable harm", Donald Trump has responded, saying he might strike Iran or he might not.
item.content:encoded: Hours after Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei warned the US and its President for interfering in the Iran-Israel conflict, saying US will "suffer irreparable harm", Donald Trump has responded, saying he might strike Iran or he might not.

item.title: Watch: PM Narendra Modi Welcomed With Gayatri Mantra In Croatia's Capital, Zagreb

media:content.media:description: PM Modi was welcomed in Zagreb with warmth, music and cultural performances.

item.description: PM Modi was warmly welcomed in Zagreb, Croatia, with cultural performances and Sanskrit chanting, symbolizing deep India-Croatia cultural relations.
item.content:encoded: PM Modi was warmly welcomed in Zagreb, Croatia, with cultural performances and Sanskrit chanting, symbolizing deep India-Croatia cultural relations.

item.title: Chinese Woman Stabbed 22 Times Survives, Thanks To Her Breast Implants

media:content.media:description: The incident occurred on May 22 at a shopping mall in southeastern China. (Representative pic)

item.description: A woman in China miraculously survived a brutal knife attack by a stranger after her breast implants shielded her from a potentially fatal wound.
item.content:encoded: A woman in China miraculously survived a brutal knife attack by a stranger after her breast implants shielded her from a potentially fatal wound.

item.title: PM Modi Arrives In Croatia On Last Leg Of Three-Nation Tour

media:content.media:description: In a special gesture, Croatian Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic received PM Modi at the airport.

item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Croatia on Wednesday on the first-ever visit by an Indian premier, during which he will hold talks with the country's top leadership to strengthen bilateral cooperation in areas of mutual interest.
item.content:encoded: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Croatia on Wednesday on the first-ever visit by an Indian premier, during which he will hold talks with the country's top leadership to strengthen bilateral cooperation in areas of mutual interest.

item.title: Kate Middleton, In Recovery From Cancer, Pulls Out Of Key Royal Event

media:content.media:description: Catherine, also known as Kate, would not be attending Royal Ascot.

item.description: Britain's Catherine, Princess of Wales, who is recovering from cancer, has pulled out of attending the Royal Ascot race meeting, her Kensington Palace office said on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: Britain's Catherine, Princess of Wales, who is recovering from cancer, has pulled out of attending the Royal Ascot race meeting, her Kensington Palace office said on Wednesday.

item.title: Indian Woman Arrested For Smuggling 1 Kg Gold At Nepal Airport: Cops

media:content.media:description: Kathmandu Airport security arrested the woman, on arrival from Sharjah. (Representational)

item.description: An Indian woman has been arrested with over one kilogramme of undeclared gold from Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, Nepal police said.
item.content:encoded: An Indian woman has been arrested with over one kilogramme of undeclared gold from Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, Nepal police said.

item.title: "No Bra, No Entry": Nigeria University Directive Sparks Online Backlash

media:content.media:description: Muizz Olatunji, president of the university's students' union, justified the practice in a post on X.

item.description: A Nigerian university has ignited an online row after a video showed female staff members touching the breasts of women to check if they were wearing bras before taking part in an exam.
item.content:encoded: A Nigerian university has ignited an online row after a video showed female staff members touching the breasts of women to check if they were wearing bras before taking part in an exam.
